customer:
Ask the customer to record a video and send it to us for analysis.
(Make sure to upload it into the system)
Check if the condenser fan blade is hitting any foreign objects.
technician:
Check if noise outside:
1.Check if the fan motor is defective.
2.Check whether there is any noise caused by loose screws.
3.Inspect the compressor for abnormal noise.

Check if noise inside:
1.The fan vibration causes noise, see the Tech Guidance PDF.

customer:
Ask the customer to take a picture and send it to us for analysis.
(Make sure to upload it into the system)

Is the Unit Level?
(A unit not being level will cause a puddle to form the a side of the unit rather than just in the back of the unit)

Drain Hose Clogged?
(Scale build up is the most likely cause of leaking within the unit. If customer is comfrotable this sort of issue is fixable over the phone by explaining how to remove and clean the drain pipe)

Is there any hot equipment placed next to the refrigerator?
(The temperature and heat from nearby hot products can directly affect the refrigerator's surface or cause excess moisture inside. This is a normal occurrence, unless the customer keeps the hot equipment far away from the refrigerator.）
technician:
Evap Drain Pan Long enough?
(This issue only occurs in older MSF units as the factory has corrected this at this time)

Silver Tape Unsealed?
(This issue is a rare one but it can happen over time with a customer who does indepth cleaning. This is visable only through removal of the fan gaurd

Check if the door gasket is damaged?
(A damaged door gasket can allow external air to enter the cabinet, leading to excessive moisture buildup

customer:
asking the customer to record a picture and send it to us for analysis.
(Make sure to upload it into the system)

Is there any hot equipment placed next to the refrigerator?
(The temperature and heat from nearby hot products can directly affect the refrigerator's surface or cause excess moisture inside. This is a normal occurrence, unless the customer keeps the hot equipment far away from the refrigerator.）
technician:
Wire Harness not Sealed?
(This occurs when the back right wire harness in the unit is not sealed properly. This appears as a small puddle sourcing near the rear right wheel)Maintenance manual required.

lower suction tube leaking water?
(This issue appears as a small trickle or puddle in the back of the unit and is visible when a tech checks the lowside insulation)Maintenance manual required.

Condenser drain pan overflow?
1.Recommend replacing it with new absorbent paperWICKING KIT INSTALL
2.Let the condensing fan run continuouslyMaintenance manual required.

customer:
Ask the customer to take a photo to confirm if anything is installed on the right side of the unite.
(Screws might damage the internal wiring, causing the display to be irreparable. This is not covered under warranty,but we can provide a repair solution.Display Wire Repair)
technician:
Check if the display port has a 24V output?
1.(Voltage Present but No Display: Reverse the terminal connector and try again. If it still doesn't display, replace the display)
2.(No Voltage: Measure the control board’s display terminal to check if there is a 24V output. if there is no voltage, the control board needs to be replaced)
3.(Terminal Connection: Inspect if the terminal inside the cabinet is not properly connected)

If the new display is still not showing and the voltage is normal.
(Try reversing the direction of the green clip terminal block and test again. It is possible that the positive and negative connections are reversed.)

customer:
asking the customer to record a picture and send it to us for analysis.
(Make sure to upload it into the system)

If the door gasket is damaged, suggest the customer replace it themselves
(as door gaskets are considered consumable parts Send the replacement tutorial video to the customer Door Gasket Replacement Video )

The Air Divider weld point is cracked.
(Send a new part to the customer, allowing them to install it themselves or arrange for a technician to perform the repairMSF INNER PAN BROKEN CORNER WELDS REPAIR

How to replace the Pilasters and Clips?
(Send the parts to the customer for self-replacement Pilasters and Clips)

If it is clearly a transportation damage issue caused by the customer during handling
(we will only send parts to the customer, not dispatch a technician)
technician:
If the caster is broken,technician will need to replace it onsite
(Remember to send the casters along with the nuts when shipping the accessories!)

If the handle is broken, Do not send the new Lid! technician needs to be dispatched for replacement
(cut the silicone seal on both sides of the lid, then separate the cover plate to access the internal screws. Reminder: After reassembling, remember to reseal with siliconeMaintenance manual required.

If there is an issue with the door, pay attention to the following when replacing it:
(When you install the new door, try opening and closing it to see if it closes by itself. If not, then it is not turned correctly or the resistance is not strong enough Door Installation Method)

customer:
Confirm with the customer which icons are displayed on the screen.
(The icons indicate that the corresponding components are functioning Basic Unit Functions)

1.Is the condenser fan working?
①.If not, check if the fan blade is obstructed by any foreign objects.
②.If it’s not obstructed but still not working, the fan needs to be replaced

2.Check if the internal evaporator fan is working?
If only one fan is not working, replace the faulty fan.
technician:
Check if Evap fans working inside——Please confirm whether the fan voltage is 115V or 24V.
(The old unit, which has an transformer, uses a 24V fan, while the updated unit uses a 115V fan)

115V Fan Troubleshooting:
1.If all fans are not working, please check if there is output 115V for the fans on the controller board Dixell Fan Voltage Test, Carel Fan Voltage Test (If there is no voltage,replace the controller board)
2. If only one fan is not working, replace the fan directly.

24V Fan Troubleshooting:
1.If all fans are not working, Check if the transformer has 115V input or 24V output:
①.If the transformer has a 115V input, but no 24V output, replace the transformer.
②.If the transformer has no 115V input,please check if there is a 115V output on the control boardDixell Fan Voltage Test (If there is no voltage,replace the controller board)

All parts are functioning properly. Please check if there is a refrigerant leak.
1.Recommend the technician to test the low-side; the normal low pressure should be 36-38 PSI
2.If the tech needs us to provide capillary tube fittings,Please let the tech know we recommend cut 2-3 inches of the end cap tube and blow the whole system by nitrogen and then replace a new universal filter drier, vacuum and recharge the unit

Is there any hot equipment placed next to the refrigerator?
(The temperature and heat from nearby hot products can directly affect the refrigerator's surface or cause excess moisture inside. This is a normal occurrence, unless the customer keeps the hot equipment far away from the refrigerator.）

customer:
The unit is completely non-functional?
(Check if the display and condenser fan are completely non-functional,Please replace the power outlet and try again to ensure there is power in the outlet.)

Please ask the customer to check if the power cord is damaged?
(If there is any damage, please take a photo and send it to us. We will send part and dispatch tech to repair it.)
technician:
If the equipment is short-circuiting:
①.Check if the control board has been damaged by water
(Usually, water can enter the control board during kitchen cleaning)
②.Check if the fan wiring is in contact with the sheet metal
(If the wiring is positioned incorrectly, prolonged vibration can cause the wiring to be cut, Repair SuggestionsMSF FAN RATTLE - TRIPPING

customer:
Dixell Parameters——(All US under-counter refrigerators use the Dixell controller)
P1:Room Probe Failure(White Proe)or Loose Wiring on the controler
P2:This unit doesn't have a defrost probe. Please calibrate the parameters first (Check the P2 parameter to see if it's set to 'n')or replace the control board.
P3&P4:Bad controller
dA:The MSF series doesn't have door magnetic switches.
It is recommended to verify all the parameters based on the parameter table in the document section
Confirm whether the wiring is correct(Please refer to the wiring method of Dixell on the Page 5 of 7)
technician:
Carel Parameters——(All Canadian under-counter refrigerators use the Carel controller)
EO:Probe 1 Failure(White Probe)
El:Probe 2 Failure(Blue Probe);(dO =0/1] [if refrigertor has El, check parameter do to 2
E3:Bad controller
Do:The MSF series doesn't have door magnetic switches.
ER:MSF product, please replace it with the Dixell three-piece set:Front display,green clip,controller board
It is recommended to verify all the parameters based on the parameter table in the document section
Confirm whether the wiring is correct(Please refer to the wiring method of Dixell on the Page 4 of 7)
